title: Lecture: Mary Beard—Will the Real Emperor Vitellius Please Stand Up? Finding a Roman Emperor in Modern Art
short_description: Join Mary Beard, Cambridge Professor Emerita and one of Britain’s best-known Classicists, for a discussion of the ancient Mediterranean world.
list_description: Join Mary Beard, Cambridge Professor Emerita and one of Britain’s best-known Classicists, for a discussion of the ancient Mediterranean world.
description:
Join Mary Beard, Cambridge Professor Emerita and one of Britain’s best-known Classicists, for a discussion of the Ancient Mediterranean world.

This lecture takes the example of one (not very well known) Roman emperor and follows his presence in modern art to consider how these ancient figures continue to mean something to us.

This program is generously sponsored by the Boshell Family Foundation.

About the Speaker

Please note that this is an in-person event that takes place at the museum.

In accordance with state and City of Chicago guidelines, visitors to the museum are no longer required to wear masks or provide proof of vaccination. Anyone who would like to continue to wear a mask is welcome to do so. Learn more about our visiting policies and what to expect.

If you have any questions about programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
